intro: Praealstonia serrulata, commonly known as the serrated alstonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
